title: Quick Tab Restore Callback Wiring
details:
## v1.6.3.5-v10 Fix: Quick Tab Restore Callback Wiring

### Issue
After restoring a minimized Quick Tab, position/size updates stop working because callbacks (onPositionChangeEnd, onSizeChangeEnd, onFocus) are not wired during _createWindow() in UICoordinator.

### Root Cause
UICoordinator._createWindow() creates QuickTabWindow instances but doesn't have access to UpdateHandler, VisibilityHandler, or DestroyHandler to wire callbacks.

### Solution Pattern
1. UICoordinator constructor accepts handlers parameter with updateHandler, visibilityHandler, destroyHandler
2. setHandlers() method allows deferred initialization after handlers are created
3. _buildCallbackOptions(quickTabId) constructs callbacks from handler methods
4. Helper methods reduce complexity: _addUpdateHandlerCallbacks(), _addVisibilityHandlerCallbacks(), _addDestroyHandlerCallbacks()
5. QuickTabsManager._initializeCoordinators() passes handlers after they're created

### Files
- src/features/quick-tabs/coordinators/UICoordinator.js
- src/features/quick-tabs/index.js

### Related Issue
Z-index after restore fixed in window.js via _applyZIndexAfterAppend() which applies z-index AFTER appendChild and forces reflow.
